structural_unit_name.en: Johan Skytte Institute of Political Studies

description.en: This course provides an overview of the main approaches to qualitative inquiry and introduces students to the core data collection and analysis methods relevant for political studies broadly conceived. The course offers hands-on skills development in qualitative data collection methods (such as in-depth interviewing, focus group research, ethnographic techniques) and in qualitative data analysis (e.g. content and narrative analysis). In addition to applied research skills, the students are invited to reflect on the issues of ethics and quality/credibility in conducting qualitative research in political studies.
description.et: Kursus teeb ülevaate peamistest lähenemistest kvalitatiivses uurimistraditsioonis ning tutvustab tudengitele põhilisi andmekogumise ja -analüüsi meetodeid poliitikauuringute läbiviimiseks. Kursus arendab tudengite praktilisi oskusi kvalitatiivsete andmekogumismeetodite (nt süvaintervjuu, fookusgrupid, etnograafiline uurimisviis) kasutamiseks ja kvalitatiivsete andmete analüüsimiseks (sh sisu- ja narratiivianalüüs). Lisaks tehnilistele oskustele võetakse vaatluse alla ka eetilised väljakutsed kvalitatiivse uurmistöö läbiviimisel ning kvalitatiivsete uuringute tulemuste usaldusväärsuse küsimus.

objectives.en: This course provides an overview of the main approaches to qualitative inquiry and introduces students to the core data collection and analysis methods relevant for political studies broadly conceived. While the focus of this course is on enabling the students to understand and apply various qualitative and interpretive research techniques in their own research projects, we will also enquire broader methodological questions behind selected qualitative/interpretive methods to investigate the logic, process and overarching principles according to which we conduct our research. The course offers hands-on skills development in qualitative and interpretive data collection methods and data analysis. In addition to applied research skills, the students will be invited to reflect upon the issues of research ethics in designing their own projects and in conducing qualitative research in general.
objectives.et: Kvalitatiivsed meetodid on magistritaseme ainekursus, mis keskendub kvalitatiivsete uurimismeetodite kasutusvõimaluste tutvustamisele akadeemiliste ja rakenduslike uurimuste läbiviimiseks. Kursuse eesmärgiks on pakkuda osalejatele vajalikke teoreetilisi teadmisi ja arendada nende praktilise uurimistöö läbiviimise oskusi, mida rakendatakse edaspidi nii akadeemilises teadustöös kui ka ametialases praktikas poliitikaanalüüsi ja -hindamise valdkonnas.

learning_outcomes.en: Upon completion of the course, the students will:
1) understand the theoretical foundations of qualitative and interpretive approaches to political research;

2) acquire the necessary knowledge and skills for designing a qualitative/interpretive research proposal, for collecting and analyzing qualitative/interpretive data, and for presenting and communicating respective findings;
learning_outcomes.et: 2) on omandanud vajalikud teadmised ja oskused kvalitatiivse uurimiskavandi väljatöötamiseks, kvalitatiivsete andmete kogumiseks ja analüüsimiseks ning uurimistulemuste esitamiseks;

learning_outcomes.en: 3) be able to critically assess and analyze qualitative and interpretive studies and ensure the credibility of qualitative/interpretive research results.
learning_outcomes.et: 3) on võimelised kriitiliselt hindama ja analüüsima kvalitatiivseid ja interpretatiivseid uuringuid ning tagama vastavate uurimistulemuste usaldusväärsust.

description.et:
Quizzes (7x2%)
To be taken before each indicated seminar.

Groupwork assignment (21%)
To be delivered in groups during the seminar sessions. Instructions and grading criteria are specified in a separate handout on this assignment.

Fieldwork Assignment (25%)
To be submitted individually during mid-term. Instructions and grading criteria are specified in a separate handout on this assignment.

Qualitative/Interpretive Research Design (40%) 
To be submitted individually as a final assignment. Instructions and grading criteria are specified in a separate handout on this assignment.

grade_preconditions.et:
- The ability to accumulate 51 points out of 100 for the final grade.
- Participation in online discussion forums (minimum in 5 of 7 of them).
- Class attendance (minimum in 80% of lectures and seminars combined).

grade_evaluation.et:
The grading scale will be as follows:
100-91 points A
90-81 points B
80-71 points C
70-61 points D
60-51 points E
50-0 points F

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)
